topic.title: Think twice before buying real estate / house
topic.body:
... especially if you have to take a loan for it

- it will make you less flexible for the next ~30-40 years
- you will become a property tax victim
- the probability of losing it is pretty high

1566891933_16wy1B4fK7XdsaZPBsQkxcnUzrcMy.body:
> [robione](#comment_292_1DoVPxFrQCDb3grC8Nsn6aACed9o2oiumX): live below your means and treat everything as assets that make you money or expenses that take it away. [...]

Agreed

> [numismatist](#comment_72_1F8BHc6FztvWRy9cttVXLj22DSSvMdbGy): I own my home outright, I pay about $2k a year in property taxes.

why do someone has to pay for something that he/she supposedly owns ?

> [numismatist](#comment_73_1F8BHc6FztvWRy9cttVXLj22DSSvMdbGy): [M] [...]

might be a better option than paying taxes for renting an illusion :-)

1566580217_1aaGBN84Cc8VE7iocUxPXiRVhx9qS.body: when your kids tell you to watch Tom and Jerry and Road Runner with them and you simply cannot say no :D

1566634528_1JaHtdmFGhdNVCzJquH7hFpsKbF7c.body:
> [darkanon](#comment_4_1HmE9NBVKZgaidhK26GKWppmafJkrHUvej): "Girls will fall in love with you by having such muscles!"

that is probably the worst attitude someone can have, but i assume it's sarcasm

boys will also fall in love in huge muscles :-)
